conclusion: To predict which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into, let's analyze the path of the liquid step by step.
The liquid from A, B, C, and D flows downward.
Observe the alignment of the baffles that could direct the flow.
The cyan baffle directs the flow from B and A towards the left and center.
The green baffle redirects the flow from C towards the center.
The white baffle guides flow from D towards the right side.
The flow from A is directed left, merging with the flow from B.
The flow from C is directed towards the center, potentially merging with some of B's flow.
The flow from D is directed towards the right side.
The combined flow from A, B, and some C goes into Container E.
The flow from D and part of C goes into Container F.
Container E will collect liquid from A, B, and some of C, while Container F will collect liquid from D and some of C.
